message: That's an arguably valid point, but it becomes irrelevant by virtue of the fact that Hillary Clinton shouldn't even be ELIGIBLE to be president because of the things she's said and done. She's been documented by the FBI as a liar (which you still won't address), and she's been documented by the FBI as a national security risk. That's pretty freakin' important. If congress could find two testicles among themselves, when they were questioning James Comey about her crimes, they should have asked him, point blank, """"If this person applied for a position with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, would you hire her?"""" And Comey would've had to say """"No."""" if he had a shred of respect for the concept of being under oath. Then their next logical question should've been, """"Why not?"""" And Comey's reply would've had to be, """"Because with her record, she couldn't possibly pass a background/security check to be hired."""" So, half the country is okay with putting this person in charge of government agencies that she couldn't even possibly get hired to work for because of her background. That's unbelievable!!! And please...spare me the """"she's more qualified"""" narrative. It lacks integrity. John McCain was a thousand times more qualified than Barack Obama. So was Mitt Romney. You wouldn't have voted for either of them.
